channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Met Police officer David Carrick admits to being serial rapist
item.description: David Carrick admits 49 offences against 12 women, including multiple rapes, over two decades.

item.title: Brixton crush: O2 Academy to remain closed, council rules
item.description: Two people died and several were injured following a crowd surge during a gig in December.

item.title: Beth Matthews: Blogger bought substance from Russia, inquest hears
item.description: Beth Matthews, 26, ordered a poisonous substance and ingested it while at a mental health unit.

item.title: UK weather: Snow and ice warnings as cold snap set to continue
item.description: A widespread frost is expected overnight, which could see temperatures drop as low as -4C.

item.title: Elle Edwards: Man charged with murder appears in court
item.description: Connor Chapman is charged with killing the 26-year-old beautician at a pub in Merseyside.

item.title: Norwich City fan died an hour before 9th birthday
item.description: Amber Sheehy, who was diagnosed with terminal cancer in April, dies "with dignity", her family says.

item.title: Transgender people lose NHS waiting times High Court case
item.description: The High Court rules the waiting times faced by four transgender people for treatment were lawful.

item.title: Whitehaven coal mine: Two legal challenges lodged
item.description: A Cumbrian campaign group and Friends of the Earth call for approval for the Whitehaven scheme to be quashed.

item.title: Cody Fisher: Third man in court charged with nightclub murder
item.description: Reegan Anderson appears before Birmingham Crown Court accused of killing Cody Fisher.

item.title: Pub flooded as river burst its banks
item.description: The Old Lock and Weir, in Bristol, is flooded after the River Avon overflowed during heavy rain.

item.title: Stoke-on-Trent man jailed for killing neighbour in phone row
item.description: Florin-Dumitru Ciurar was found dead at an address in Stoke-on-Trent in August.

item.title: Five-year-old joins police bike ride along
item.description: Harry rides along police on a motorbike he got from Santa for Christmas.

item.title: Aurora hunter treated by coastal lights display
Cornwall oystermen battle to save way of life
item.description: They say their traditional way of life on the Fal Estuary was knocked sideways by post-Brexit rule changes.

item.title: West End actress fights to change cat hit-and-run law
item.description: People are not currently required to tell police if they hit a cat while driving.

item.title: Clacton: The real 'Phoenix Nights' club fights for survival
item.description: A working men's club at risk of closure a year ago is fighting back by attracting younger members.

item.title: Cost of living: The father and son who write poetry for tough times
item.description: Winston "Mayor" Lindsay and his son, Zayden, perform poetry about socio-economic issues.

item.title: Frodsham rewilding: What happens when a golf course returns to nature?
item.description: A former course is home to badgers and foxes after returning to nature as part of a rewilding scheme.

item.title: England Six Nations squad: Billy Vunipola, Jonny May & Jack Nowell left out by Steve Borthwick
item.description: Number eight Billy Vunipola has been left out of new head coach Steve Borthwick's 36-man England squad for the Six Nations.

item.title: Australian Open: Emma Raducanu and Cameron Norrie through in Melbourne
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu makes a positive return to court after an ankle injury, while Cameron Norrie also moves into the Australian Open second round.

item.title: Alan Shearer column: Why Arsenal are in control of the Premier League title race
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer says Arsenal will take some shifting from the top of the Premier League but Manchester City and Manchester United are still in the title race.

item.title: Masters snooker final 2023: Judd Trump beats Mark Williams to claim second title
item.description: Judd Trump says his Masters win over Mark Williams is his "best ever" after claiming the title for a second time.

item.title: Australian Open 2023: Jack Draper loses to Rafael Nadal at Melbourne Park
item.description: British rising star Jack Draper tests Spanish great Rafael Nadal before more physical issues cost him in a four-set defeat at the Australian Open.
